glsa.title: Okular: Arbitrary code execution
glsa.synopsis: A heap-based buffer overflow in Okular might allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code or cause a Denial of Service condition.

background.p: Okular is a universal document viewer based on KPDF for KDE 4.

description.p: Okular contains a heap-based buffer overflow in the RLE decompression functionality in the TranscribePalmImageToJPEG function in generators/plucker/inplug/image.cpp.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted PBD file using Okular, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, or a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
